title: 2013 US Open – Women's singles
text:
Defending champion <a href="Serena%20Williams">Serena Williams</a> successfully defended her title, defeating <a href="Victoria%20Azarenka">Victoria Azarenka</a> in a rematch of the previous year's final, 7–5, 6–7(6–8), 6–1 to win the women's singles tennis title at the 2013 US Open. It was her fifth <a href="US%20Open%20%28tennis%29">US Open</a> singles title and her 17th <a href="Grand%20Slam%20%28tennis%29%23Tournaments">major</a> singles title overall. For the second consecutive year, Williams lost only one set during the tournament, to Azarenka in the final.
This was the last major main draw appearance for former world No. 3 and two-time <a href="French%20Open">French Open</a> semifinalist <a href="Nadia%20Petrova">Nadia Petrova</a>, who lost to <a href="Julia%20Glushko">Julia Glushko</a> in the first round.
